data.title: Needs some improvements
data.text: We drove to Everett for a concert at the Xfinity Arena for a band that I've wanted to see for 30 years.  The concert itself was amazing; worth every penny and a speeding ticket getting there. The venue itself has a few things that need improvement.  Getting in to the venue takes quite some time due to their security measures.  We stood outside for quite a while waiting to get thru.  The acoustics are not the greatest.  I usually use earplugs at a concert to protect my hearing but at this one I took them out to hear the words. The seats were not what we expected either.  Based on the seating chart I assumed that they would sit above the stage in a balcony area a little more; however, we were across the arena with folks walking across the floor all evening.  The seats that we were in were also a little rickety and  lopsided.  I was so excited to be there that we made the best of it and enjoyed the concert to the fullest.

data.title: Always fun to go to this venue
data.text: I've come her for many different events. Always enjoy the time and they have a efficient way to get you out and on your way. Parking can be challenging for some big events.

data.title: Infinity Arena
data.text:
Love attending activities at Infinity Arena.
The seating is great and comfortable. Great view from any seat.
They need to build a parking garage. It is very difficult to find parking close to the arena.

data.title: Silver tip hockey
data.text: Love this venue. Always clean. Well maintained building. Good food choices for all events. Parking is okay

data.title: game
data.text: close to i-5 . indoor game was good experince .due to bad weather. like the area.will sure come back again for upcoming concerts .

data.title: Great Venue!
data.text: I have attended shows at this venue a couple of times. I have always sat on the sides, and feel that the visibility is great! I really like this venue.

data.title: Need more parking in the area.
data.text: Recently been to Duran-Duran Concert at this venue, it was nice, however it would be nicer if the show was right in the middle of The court. The majority of the people attended were located on the risers, sitting sideways, people with their cell phones recording and take pictures block our vision...

data.title: Great Concert Venue
data.text: We saw Duran Duran and Chic w/ Nile Rodgers here. What a great venue! There were really no bad seats and the acoustics were solid for an arena. We had no problem finding parking or getting out of the general area afterwards. I wish I could attend all the concerts I want to see here...

data.title: Great venue with good views throughout
data.text:
I saw Duran Duran here last night and enjoy coming here as most seats you can enjoy a good view even if you don't pay top dollar.

Two things I would change:

1. Beer and wine is allowed on the main floor but not hard alcohol. That is very strange.

2. When purchasing tickets, I had to do it manually for part of my order because they do not allow a one seat gap in between seats. While I understand the reasoning for it, it was the week of the show and there were still plenty of seats. Also, there are many people that go two shows on their own. I don't think there's a strong need to put that kind of programming in your online ticketing program.

data.title: Mostly Good
data.text:
Been here for three events so far. First off, it's awesome to have this kind of arena in Everett. It's small enough that there are no bad seats, but large enough to attract some great venues. You also don't have to fight the Seattle traffic to get in and out of Everett. Fun places to eat of have a beer nearby too. 

A couple of things I didn't like. I'm 6'6'' tall. The seats are pretty close together and not a lot of leg room. I went with three other people and I'm probably the only one who isn't completely comfortable with the seating because of my long legs. 

Xfinity Arena is also an ice rink for the Everett Silvertips (WHL) Ice hockey team. When there is a venue at the arena on the floor, they cover the ice rink up with heavy boards. My wife and I went to a theater production that was touring from New York and the best seats were on the floor over the ice rink. It got cold, even though the rink was fully covered. I don't think I would recommend having seats on the floor for a show. It's better in the stands. 

So, I appreciate having the Arena, and those are my only two negative comments.

data.title: Hockey fans
data.text: I enjoy hochey here gets that closer and involved feeling they do excellent job with fan participation. We thank both the arena and the Silvertips for being a well run program.

data.title: Celtic Woman
data.text: The choices below doesn't let me put in the correct time frame.  It was over a year ago, but it was a very memorable & pleasant time together with family & friends.  We all wished that they had done more Irish Dancing; I think they only did one number.  But they are a very talented singing group whose voices compliment & blend together beautifully.  A very nice venue.

data.title: Everyone is welcome
data.text: It is a great place to watch hockey games or concerts.The only negative comment I have is the parking. It would be nice to see them get some kind of garage.

data.title: A Great Facility with Great Events
data.text: We've gone here for SilverTips games, LaCrosse, Rodeo, Arena Football, Concerts, and more.  It is well built with good seating.  The lower level has MUCH more leg room than the upper level.  Concession prices are astronomical as is to be expected.

data.title: Conference with Stars
data.text: Excellent, friendly staff willing to assist in any way. Great food and convenient parking. Plenty of accommodations and local eateries for every palette.

data.title: Love watching the Silvertips here!
data.text: Very clean, comfortable place to watch ANY event at. We usually watch the Everett Silvertips here. Would recommend to anyone!

data.title: Easy access even with the parking on strreet
data.text: We arrived a bit early for the gymnastics competition on Saturday and was not sure how it would be to find parking. It was really quite easy.

data.title: abundance of free parking around the arena
data.text: Xfinity arena is an above average venue. This facility is about 10 years old and houses 10,000 in a hockey venue and less for concerts and special events. They have a 2 level wrap around seating which is unusual for medium to small size venue. Most venues this small size only has one level and does not wrap around. The scoreboard has had a major improvement. The things that sets this venue apart from Seattle is that there is an abundance of free street parking in the area around the facility. There are paid parking lots and a large underground paid parking garage on the NW corner of the event center but don't be fooled, there is plenty of free parking, especially to the west anywhere from 1 - 4 easy walking blocks away.

data.title: Indoor rock concert, not very good acoustics
data.text: Went to an indoor concert (rock, 5FDP) and I found the acoustics terrible. It is hard to get to/from your seats easily to get to the restrooms. It was clean enough. Also, too many think you want to smoke pot that they are smoking in the open.

data.title: Sports Event
data.text: I was there for the Pac-Rim Gymnastics. Excellent arena and very good seating and facilities. Sound and acoustics were excellent too.
